meanings.definition: To march or force someone to move forward against their will.
meanings.sent1: The police officer frogmarches the criminal to the patrol car.
meanings.sent2: The security guard frogmarches the troublemaker out of the store.
meanings.sent3: The teacher frogmarches the late student to the principal's office.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind frogmarches the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The determined coach frogmarches the team to victory.

meanings.definition: To move someone by grabbing their arms and forcing them to walk.
meanings.sent1: The bully frogmarches the smaller kid down the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The soldier frogmarches the prisoner to the interrogation room.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully frogmarch each other around the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The current frogmarches the swimmer downstream.
meanings.sent5: The parent frogmarches the sleepy child to bed.
